meanings.definition: To populate with too many people.
meanings.sent1: The small town became overpeopled after the new factory opened.
meanings.sent2: The city overpeoples during rush hour, causing traffic jams.
meanings.sent3: The picnic area was overpeopled with families enjoying the sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The classroom overpeopled with students eager to learn.
meanings.sent5: The bus overpeoples with passengers during peak hours.

meanings.definition: To exceed the number of people.
meanings.sent1: The stadium overpeoples when a popular band performs.
meanings.sent2: The elevator overpeoples when too many people try to squeeze in.
meanings.sent3: The boat overpeoples with tourists excited to see dolphins.
meanings.sent4: The restaurant overpeoples on weekends, leading to long wait times.
meanings.sent5: The train station overpeoples with commuters during rush hour.

meanings.sent1: Overpeople can strain resources in a community.
meanings.sent2: The overpeople of a city can lead to overcrowding issues.
meanings.sent3: The overpeople of the park caused it to close for maintenance.
meanings.sent4: The overpeople of the event made it difficult to move around.
meanings.sent5: The overpeople of the beach made finding a spot to relax challenging.
